docs.title: Declo
docs.text:
pip install git+https://github.com/arunpatro/declo

Declo is a Python dialect that brings JavaScript-like functional programming patterns to Python, making functional code more concise and readable.

docs.title: Why?
docs.text: I wanted to bring the excellent ergonomics of map, filter, chaining of functional transformations to python. We already have that in pandas, torch, so why not extend this to the rest of the language?

docs.title: 1. Compile Declo code to Python
docs.text:
# File: list_comp.declo
nums = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]
squares = nums.map(x => x * x)
evens = nums.filter(x => x % 2 == 0)

declo compile list_comp.declo

# File: list_comp.py
nums = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]
squares = [x * x for x in nums]
evens = [x for x in nums if x % 2 == 0]

docs.title: Local Development
docs.text:
To localdev, 

curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh
git clone https://github.com/arunpatro/declo
cd declo
uv venv --python 3.12
uv sync --dev
uv pip install -e .

Now you are all set to start developing the declo project.

docs.title: Tests
docs.text: Here is how we can run tests for this project. This will be used to make the project spec compliant and measure our goals on how to acheive the spec.

docs.title: Setup
docs.text:
First install the declo project in editable mode for this environment.

uv pip install -e .

docs.title: Running tests
docs.text:
